Title:
Blastosporium persicolor gen. et sp. nov., a new helotialean
fungus.
Abstract:
A new genus and species, Blastosporium persicolor, is
described and illustrated from leaves of mildewed tobacco; it is
characterized by branched, septate hyphae from which arising
macronematous, unbranched or spaced branched conidiophores, and mono- or
polyblastic conidiogenous cells that produced solitary and
blastocatenate, obovoid, oblong, ellipsoidal, allantoid, broad fusiform
to irregular, unicellular, hyaline conidia. The phylogenetic analyses
based on the combined sequence data from the small and large nuclear
subunit ribosomal DNA (SSU and LSU), B. persicolor was placed in the
Leotiomycetes class, Helotiales order.
